articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Jeff Mason
articles.description: NATO leaders gather in The Hague on Wednesday for a summit tailor-made for U.S. President Donald Trump, with European allies hoping a pledge to hike defence spending will prompt him to dispel doubts about his commitment to the alliance.
articles.title: NATO leaders set to back Trump defence spending goal at Hague summit

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: The ceasefire brokered by U.S. President Donald Trump between Iran and Israel appeared to be holding on Wednesday a day after both countries signalled that their air war had ended, at least for now.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holding, Trump envoy says peace talks with Iran 'promising'

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: China has taken a series of actions in the past week on counter-narcotics, in a sign of cooperation with U.S. demands for stronger action on the synthetic opioid fentanyl, a key irritant in the bilateral relationship.
articles.title: China takes action on key US fentanyl demands

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop, Jan Strupczewski
articles.description: European Union leaders are to tell the European Commission on Thursday if they want a quick trade deal with the United States at the cost of Washington getting better terms, or to escalate the fight in hope of something better.
articles.title: EU to canvass leaders at summit on resolving US tariff conflict

articles.author: Joe Cash, Shi Bu, Farah Master
articles.description: Towns and villages by a major river in China's Guangxi lay half-submerged as floodwaters from a province upstream roared into the mountainous region, with the expected landfall of a tropical cyclone later on Thursday compounding disaster risk.
articles.title: China's Guangxi deluged by flood-waters from upstream province

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Wednesday called for Israel to pardon Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu or cancel his corruption trial, saying the U.S. would save him like it did his country.
articles.title: Trump calls for Israeli PM's trial to be canceled

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the U.S. has not given up its maximum pressure on Iran - including restrictions on sales of Iranian oil - but signaled a potential easing in enforcement to help the country rebuild.
articles.title: Trump signals US may ease Iran oil sanction enforcement to help rebuild country

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that the intelligence following the strikes on Iranian nuclear sites was inconclusive, but also suggested the damage could have been severe.
articles.title: Trump says intelligence on Iran was inconclusive, but suggests severe damage

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump wants a pay raise for troops, more high-tech missiles and drones in next year's defense budget, while cutting Navy jobs, and buying fewer ships and fighter jets to save money, according to budget materials posted Wednesday.
articles.title: Trump wants more drones and missiles, fewer F-35s in $893 billion budget request

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A former director of Venezuelan military intelligence, Hugo Carvajal, pleaded guilty on Wednesday to drug trafficking and narcoterrorism charges in U.S. federal court, the Justice Department said in a statement.
articles.title: Venezuela's ex-spymaster pleads guilty to US drug trafficking charges
